name: Brooklands Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights 7 & 8th of May 2010 before taking part in the MG owners Heritage run to Brighton on the Sunday.
reviews.title: Luxury at the Brooklands

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel looks very impressive from the outside and the inside did not dissapoint. We had a standard room overlooking the racetrack great view it was very large and airy. I liked the colour scheme black, white, grey and a touch of red. Bed really huge and comfortable with big squishy cushions lots of soft fluffy towels in the bathroom. We ate in the resturant one night and it was very good food staff more than helpful. Breakfast very good loads to choose from always hot and inviting.
reviews.title: A winner for us!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We used the spa facilites the outside hot tub was great on the 3rd floor this also looks out over the racetrack. Staff in the spa very helpful even if you did not want any teatments nothing was too much trouble. I tried out a facial and it was so relaxing no pressure to buy the products like at some spas.
reviews.title: Nice but teething problems

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Eveyone at the Brooklands was so friendly and helpful we enjoyed our stay very much and would visit again. Only one small down side if you want an early night ask for a room that is not above one of the function rooms as the noise from the disco is quite loud till midnight.
reviews.title: Can't fault the place!!

reviews.text: Although we were booked into another hotel close by, we had read about the Brooklands Hotel in a couple of publications and thought we would give it a go. How right we were to change! The hotel facade is certainly impressive and the lobby very contemporary, just our sort of place. At reception were we dealt with efficiently, but I think that the some of the staff are still getting to grips with the computer system. We were shown to our room by a very polite staff member and what a room. Huge bed, waffle robes (only 1 however - just an over-sight - quickly rectified), walk in rain shower, I could go on but you get the idea - fantastic.
reviews.title: Lovely New Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel as a base for a weekend of sightseeing. It was ideal for trips to Hampton court about 20 minutes drive, and for the Brooklands motor museum about 5 minutes walk. Families can enjoy the Mercedes Benz world where there is everything for the car enthusiast. Well worth a visit.
reviews.title: Ideal for weekend breaks

reviews.text: I am disgusted. We opted for the £149 stay with food and a facial. Never again.We're were meant to cheack in by 3pm went to the desk and was told like many other with the wame package the rooms were not ready. We then were told to go for the tapas meal we were entitled to and come back. Again we did and were told our room was not ready. When I complained and lost my temper was told they would call the police and I was no longer welcome. I was not only the only person who had the experience. Never in all my years. Do not go there the manager was the rudest ill nmanared man I have ever known who cannot deal with customer service but would throw you out rather than deal.
reviews.title: What can I say. Never again. Never go for a groupon stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have to admit that this is one of the most up market places I have stayed in in England and at a bargain rate through Groupon .Overall our stay was excellent.
reviews.title: Great one night break

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were greeted by a charming, informative man on the desk who gave us the nice news that we had been upgraded free of charge to room 145. A massive two room suite with a terrific view straight over the Mercedes world track. We were blown away with the room which was immaculate and very posh. Plus the bed was really big and so comfy I felt like staying there for the day.
reviews.title: Overall good stay, but disappointed with Spa T&Cs

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel was clean and staff were all pleasant. Spa staff were helpful and again most pleasant.
reviews.title: Pleasant stay

reviews.text: The service at this hotel was outstanding. While the rooms are a good size they lack some basics such as sheer curtains, note pads and decent lighting (it was impossible to put on makeup in the low light). Room service menu is limited.
reviews.title: Ok hotel

reviews.text: I stayed at Brooklands for the first time. Last time, which was March 2013, stayed at Oatlands hotel and it has some interesting atmosphere. Brookalnds is much modern, elegant and ease-of-use facility including smooth internet connections and they are perfect for my business trip to Weybridge. There was no nearby restaurant and I had to take every meal at the hotel restaurant. It was pricey but the food quality was amazing. I loved the breakfast and it was one of the best breakfast I had every had. Staff was helpful and friendly and I liked the receptionist's welcome remarks at my check-in. I would definitely go for this hotel again in my future business trip to Weybridge.
reviews.title: Pleasant stay for business

reviews.text: Been here several times and always had a great experience.
reviews.title: Can't Keep Away

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Check-in was easy although a bit of confusion in regards to the spa treatments which came with my deal. That was quickly sorted out though.
reviews.title: Lovely stay

reviews.text: Rooms are moderns and well decorated. Can fault the cleanliness at all.
reviews.title: Brooklands hotel

reviews.text: Regrettably it was for 'one night only' but we had a great experience at Brooklands Hotel the accommodation was excellent and the staff were very friendly. We look forward to staying at Brooklands again in the near future.
reviews.title: Can't ask for more

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here on a Groupon deal and had a lovely night away. The receptionist that checked us in was very helpful and although it was just past 2pm our room was ready. The room was amazing. Big room, big windows, very stylish, clean and modern. The bathroom again was very modern and stylish. We had pre booked our spa treatments and they were ready for us, and after those we laid out on the deck with a drink and watched the people driving around the track at Mercedes Benz world. Dinner was lovely and again the waiters very attentive. Only slight negative was as we checked in they asked if we would like a complimentary newspaper the next morning which we did and asked for the Telegraph. As we checked out we had to pay for this as the only complimentary paper was the mail!! The reception didn't tell us that.
reviews.title: Lovely Hotel

reviews.text: The hotel was amazing, suite was lovely, bed was very comfortable. I found most of the staff to be great, very friendly and very helpful, although some of the younger waiting staff and the spa staff came across a bit rude and not very hospitable. Other than this everything else was perfect. The food was to die for!
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel, I would deffinatly stay again.

reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights as we were attending a wedding close by. The hotel is situated overlooking the famous race track at "Brooklands", which is well worth a visit.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel close to London

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a very modern, stylish room with all amenities.Spotless and smart. Everything worked well and the 6 foot bed was very comfortable.
reviews.title: Great Suite but housekeeping a let down

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Initially found this hotel as a groupon deal, but after a previous experience with a groupon hotel booking I was a little hesitant. But as my partner is a bit of a car nut, it seemed to good an offer to refuse.
reviews.title: What a great find...

reviews.text: Well I shouldn't have worried. After booking, I contacted the hotel to ask about a track facing room as it was my partners birthday (I booked it as a complete surprise for him, and he didn't know until we turned into the drive way despite having passed numerous tourist signs along the way) - the staff that I dealt with all over email couldn't have been more helpful. For £10 it was definitely worth it, and would recommend the upgrade to one of these rooms. Having picked up on that this was a birthday booking I was sent a price list of additional things I could book for the room. As I had quite a few other things booked elsewhere and over a number of days, I didn't take up the offer
reviews.title: Excellent hotel and location

reviews.text: With a room overlooking the track we continued to watch the cars going round later into the evening. The room was spacious and more than enough room for two. The room was clean and well kept.
reviews.title: A great find!

reviews.text: All the staff that we came across during our stay were very courteous and friendly. We had to report that our bathroom door was not shutting properly, and within minutes of telling reception, someone was at the room in minutes. We have reported issues at other hotels and had to wait a while for maintenance to arrive, so big thumbs up there Brooklands Hotel!!!!
reviews.title: A nice place to stay

reviews.text: We ate in the restaurant, and me being a fussy eater I found that the menu catered for all food choices and I was certainly left feeling very full - ok we did have pudding as well
reviews.title: Lovely relaxing break

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We saw in the press that this hotel was opening on Monday the 8th of March so booked a room for Saturday the 13th to check it out. The hotel is on the site of the old Brooklands race track and very easy to find. Just follow the signs for Mercedes World, which is next door. The hotel building is a lovely design. As we parked in the large car park in front a member of staff came out to greet us and take our bags. The bags were tagged and put on a luggage trolley while we checked in and delivered to our room in minutes. The lobby has the wow! factor but I won't spoil your pleasure by describing it here. I will mention that part of the Brooklands circuit used to run where the lobby is and it's been picked out in floor tiles. Reception staff were very polite and helpful, even coming out from behind the desk to escort us to the lifts which is unusual in our experience.
reviews.title: Fabulous new hotel

reviews.text: Upstairs the corridor has automatic lighting that switches on as you walk in and when you leave your room. Our room was furnished in modern fashion with a 6 foot wide bed, large TFT TV with Freeview and excellent bathroom with a very large walk-in shower, though no bath.
reviews.title: Loved Brooklands

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Downstairs again, the bar is huge with friendly, efficient service and extensive drinks menu. Dinner in the beautifully designed restaurant was excellent with a very good wine list. Breakfast the next morning was very good in both content and value with a well-stocked buffet and a good choice of hot items on the menu. Breakfast was enlivened by being able to watch Mercedes cars being driven on their track and skid pan right in front of the hotel - don't worry, you can't hear them from inside and they didn't begin until 10am. It would be a wonderful treat to be taken to the Brooklands Hotel and then to drive a new Mercedes! The Brooklands Museum, which can be seen from the hotel, is just a 5 minute walk away and well worth a visit.
reviews.title: Stunning hotel and facilities but staff with no customer service let it down!

reviews.text: We stayed at the openeing of the hotel. The facilities were superb, modern with every detail thought out. It really has the wow factor. The dinner was excellant and service good considering its a new hotel and the staff need to get used operating. Would certainly stay again and woul recomend to everyone.
reviews.title: Fantastic New Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Looking for a 24 hour Easter break, this just out of it's wrapper hotel was highly recommended to me. Friends of mine had stayed the night before and they couldn't stop praising the hotel, spa and their room. Their Suite was bigger then their 2 bedroom flat!! And they had great views of Mercedes Benz World and the cars racing around the track. And don't worry about any noise of trains, cars, planes, you can not hear a thing with the windows or patio doors closed.
reviews.title: Wow! Wow! Wow!

reviews.text: The spa treatments were out of this world and my "macial" (Mans facial) was of perfection. So much so that I fell asleep! The relaxing peaceful massage was out of this world as well!
reviews.title: Stunning and Superb!

reviews.text: We had lunch, dinner and breakfast in the hotel and the food and service was outstanding! The Lamb Shank, chicken breast and breaded sword fish Milanese were top notch!! Our dinner for two with a couple of glasses of wine and one desert was only £60!! I would suggest having your dinner in the more secluded "Purple room" as we called it. The brasserie is nice, but this room although attached to the brasserie seems more intimate.
reviews.title: Best Hotel I have stayed in!

reviews.text: We stayed in an executive suite and it was incredible! With a seperate bedroom and a lounge that was massive with a sectional couch big enough for 10 people! Lovely table and chairs for 6 people, a writing desk and fabulous decor.
reviews.title: Simply the Best, Better than all the Rest......................

description: Located in the stunning county of Surrey, just 20 minutes from London and standing where the world famous Brooklands race track once reigned supreme during the 1920s and 30s. The Brooklands Hotel takes this iconic inspiration to deliver a new kind of unique experience.
